6.text:
I’m 67, and I’ve done the lasting power
of attorney for my mother. My mum’s grasp

13.text:
on modern-day living, as it were, was a bit
limited, so it was decided then that I would

21.text:
pay all the bills, sort everything out for
her.

25.text:
Three years ago I had a stroke and you start
thinking about your own mortality, and you

32.text:
start thinking about, “If something had
have happened to me, then how would Mum have

37.text:
coped? What would have happened?”
Anyway, looking on the internet, and I literally

45.text:
stumbled across the government site for the
lasting power of attorney, started to look

52.text:
at it and I thought, “This is good, because
you can download all the paperwork yourself,

57.text:
you don’t need a solicitor, and the instructions
that went with each section of the lasting

64.text:
power of attorney, they were in proper people
speak, not in legal jargon, so it was very

72.text:
easy for me to follow it.
If I can do it, anybody can do it, you know.

78.text:
It’s easy… the written instructions, you
just can’t go wrong. And I would say now

86.text:
to anybody, “Don’t be frightened, don’t
worry about going to see a solicitor; do it yourself.

91.text:
And I’m glad I did it and I’m
glad I did it when I did it. My mum is really pleased.”

105.text:
Can I say, “Thank you”? Of course you can.
Yes, of course you can.

108.text:
I just want to say, “Thank you,” to everybody
involved in doing the website, because it’s

117.text:
given me peace of mind and I’m sure it gives
a lot of people peace of mind. My friend now

125.text:
is doing that and you’ve made it so simple
and so easy for anybody to do. I just hope

134.text:
that anybody who sees this film, please, do
it, and you’ll feel so relieved afterwards.

145.text:
You know, it’s great to know that the people
that you care for, everything is looked after for them.
